text.section: Each day that a violation of any section of Subtitle 4 of this title continues constitutes a separate offense.

Within 10 days after a court renders the conviction, the court shall report to the Board each conviction of a pharmacist or registered pharmacy technician for:
Any crime regarding the pharmacy or drug laws that involves professional misconduct; or
Any crime that involves the State law regarding controlled dangerous substances or the federal narcotic laws.

section.section: Any person who violates § 12-701 ("Practicing pharmacy without a license"), § 12-703 ("Operating a pharmacy without a permit"), or § 12-6B-12 ("Working as an unregistered pharmacy technician") of this title is subject to a civil fine of not more than $50,000 to be assessed by the Board.
The Board shall pay any penalty collected under this subsection into the State Board of Pharmacy Fund.
